comments.body: It would be kinda bad if someone had a fantastic build that was so big it went above the clouds, and it got obliterated by another house hurtling through the air.
These are all great ideas. I think villagers have a lot of money, so I think they deserve better houses (in-line with what is specified in the Plains, above.

Savanna:

  • Armadillos could spawn in animal pens and butcher pens on structure generation in addition to regular livestock.
  • Savanna houses should have chances to find copper ingots, brushes, acacia logs and armadillo scutes.
  • All pottery sherds should very rarely be found in savanna mason houses.

In keeping with the whole Aztec vibe, it should also be a stepped pyramid. Make them vary a little bit in size and appearance, too. There should be a 1% chance for the temple to be the same size as an ocean temple, 60% chance of equaling the size of a desert temple(with more room underground), and a 39% chance for it to be slightly bigger than the current temple, in outside dimensions. Something like that, Idk.
Yes very tricky puzzles, with very worth it loot
Neat concept, but the Aztecs were mostly an arid-temperate mountain Empire. I think a Mayan vibe would fit better

P.S. Yes I know some of the ideas I have stated such as the anti beacon are already posted, I am simply using those as a reference, and the hope that if those are added on this will be added on as well using those as building blocks. Just like many other things on here use other ideas or things already existent within Minecraft as their own building blocks. This not meant as a way for me to add my own ideas to how these other ideas should work. I'll be putting those on the actual posts for those ideas. Anyways I think this would be a pretty cool rare find.

I really like this idea, however instead of just having it be a pillager fort since we already have pillager towers, I think it would be great to make it an illager fort that includes all of the illagers. This  would include pillagers, vindicators, witches, ravagers, and rarely evokers. And for the anti-beacon, or de-con, I figure that it could simply work by only affecting the player and not hostile mobs when it is naturally generated, until the player has harvested it and placed it themselves, then it will affect hostile mobs and not the player. Otherwise, wonderful idea, I support it all the way! Perhaps it could be an uncommon structure in mountain biomes, I feel like that would be cool.

Devon Eckley, yeah I think an all around fortress would work. When it comes to the rarity I would think ot would probably go somewhere in this order:
Pillager
Vindicator
Witch
Evoker
Ravager
Illusioner
Or something like that. I do still believe pillagers should be the most common when it comes to the fortress, but the others being there also sounds quite interesting. The only question I have now is what should the fortress be made out of and what would power an anti beacon. One thing to consider when discussing this is how rare this structure will be in comparison to the items found within it, and the blocks it's made of.
Illager(definion): A desendent of Piller or Eve.  All pillagers and evokers are illagers.
Evokers should be commen, given the fact that they are cousins. (Piller and Eve were twins).

really Nice idea!!! but you know that Pillagers are part of the illager family?

End City Ruins should be fallen over or have branches that have fallen off. As they and Sunken End Ships would be easier to navigate, their loot would not be as good. Damaged Elytras would be a rare find still
I am not as enthusiastic about cracked blocks and Shulkers. They could have trailing and missing blocks, as well as Chorus Plants growing through them

Small and/or Damaged End Pillars could be found littered around. It would be cool if they had chunks taken out of them. The top part of the pillars could have crying obsidian on them to indicate that End Crystals blew up there.

Sunken End Ships could have craters or trails on large End Islands, but it would also be interesting if it looked like they crashed into the small End Islands, possibly with some debris from the ship and the island

While I like the idea, one issue I see is people going to look for End Cities and the first one they come across is in ruins. On the other hand, it could be made so End City Ruins (End Ruins?) are more common than the intact ones
End Cities could also have a variety of rooms, one of which I think should be a Fountain room, like the End Fountain

Abandoned cities? Yes. Fallen ships? Yes. Expanding the lore of the end? Uh yes! First of all, I want to go off by saying I love anything that is abandoned. It helps add to the lore but most importantly, it can give an eerie vibe, which I seriously love. Hopefully, this gets added in the End Update.
I have nothing to say appart that this idea fits the game and should definitely be added! Also, love the fact that you can actually go inside the log, very nice.

i would like to see a change in the frequency of the ruined portals and pillager outpost. how come when i first started playing minecraft getting to the nether was pre end game but now you can get there within 10 minutes when i spawn i find atleast 4 ruined portals but no pillager outpost even tho trading is available right off rip it makes no sense

I think that if you really want people to vote for this you should rewrite it becuase the way it is now doesn't make too much sense. It's all over the place and I am having trouble understanding exactly what you want.

With the Nether update coming next, I think this is a very underrated suggestion that should definitely be taken into account. I was actually coming here to suggest this very thing, but checked if anyone else suggested it yet, and lo and behold, they have. I do think it needs to be described a little better though, so here you go:

  • Nether portals can be made both horizontally and vertically, perhaps even in any shape we want.
  • Portals of all kinds get a special render, which shows the other side, including mobs moving around, such as the Nether or End (basically it loads the chunks on the other side of the portal, as long as the portal itself is loaded).
  • Transfer to the new dimension is as instantaneous as possible, so it feels more fluid to travel to dimensions.
  • Recommend having an option to disable the render, so that players with weaker PCs don't get massive frame drops when around portals.
  • The ability to fly through nether portals with an elytra, and ride through nether portals on a mount.

I think that pretty much gets everything? Ideally, Mojang would implement this in a way that modders can even take advantage of easier, but that's not super important, and is up to Mojang in the end if they want to make it easier for us.
I would love this

This are the kind of design decisions that drive me crazy. The only reason I could see to keep it is sometimes the chests are blocked from opening, which adds to the difficulty of looting them early in the game without a breathing helmet or potion.

I think ruins should definitely have them, since you have to dig around anyway. The main loot in a ship should be a chest but the minor ones that are more accessible should be barrels, or even just have one or two on the deck with junk in them for decoration, or even laying somewhere near the ship on the ocean floor filled with "goods" the ship was carrying. Would be a good way to get crops, seeds, or other minor items early.
A mix of both would be nice since pirates use both. Maybe only the captains quarters have chests
This make sense.
That's a great and gloomy idea.
I agree 👍
it would be nice to have some variation so have some use mangrove wood or oak or spruce
